content: The historic city of Petra, carved directly into vibrant red, white, pink, and sandstone cliff faces, is located in which Middle Eastern country?

Petra is located in Jordan, a Middle Eastern country known for its rich history and cultural heritage. This ancient city, also known as the "Rose City" due to the color of the stone from which it is carved, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World. It was originally established as the capital city of the Nabataean kingdom around the 6th century BC and is famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system. Today, Petra attracts tourists from all over the world who come to marvel at its intricate carvings, learn about its history, and experience the unique atmosphere of this archaeological treasure.
